intro: Ononis bernhardii, commonly known as the hardstem whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Ononis bernhardii is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
